shortlist.name: Ammes (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Comes off a win, indicating peak form. Sean Bowen is a reliable jockey, and the odds reflect strong market confidence. No signs of needing improvement; connections are in good order.

shortlist.name: Treasure Planet (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Represents top connections with Paul Nicholls and Harry Cobden. Market support is notable for a debutant, suggesting strong stable confidence and likely readiness. Excluded longshots, and this runner is the only viable alternative to the favourite.

shortlist.name: Ben Solo (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placed efforts, including a close second last time out. Trainer and jockey are in good current form. Odds are fair for a horse with solid claims and no obvious negatives.

shortlist.name: Tintintin (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Won two starts back and has been competitive in better races. Trainer and jockey are both reliable, and the horse is proven at this level. Slightly shorter odds than Ben Solo, but still represents value given connections and proven ability.

shortlist.name: In The Air (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Won last two starts and is clearly in form. Trainer and jockey are less high-profile but the horse is improving rapidly. Odds are slightly bigger than the front two, offering a touch of value for a horse with upward momentum.

shortlist.name: Starcrossed Lover (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Won two starts ago and was a close second last time. Trainer is capable and the horse is consistent. Odds are attractive for a horse with recent winning form and no obvious regression signs.

shortlist.name: Destroytheevidence
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows consistency with a strong finish in the last race. The odds reflect its current form and potential for improvement.

shortlist.name: Ile De Jersey (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with a win and a second place. The trainer-jockey combination is highly respected, adding to its chances.

shortlist.name: Ask Brewster (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes a win and consistent placings. The trainer has a good record with similar horses.

shortlist.name: Neon Moon (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows a mix of wins and placings. The trainer is known for preparing horses well for similar races.

shortlist.name: French Ship
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with multiple wins last season, including a strong finish to the campaign. Returns for top connections who excel with fresh horses at this meeting. Market support is strong, indicating confidence. No signs of decline in recent form.

shortlist.name: Royal Infantry (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at a good level, placed in competitive races last season. Trained by Dan Skelton, who targets this meeting, and partnered by stable jockey. Form is reliable and odds are fair for a horse with proven class.

shortlist.name: Gibbs Island
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile last season with back-to-back wins before a pulled-up and a below-par effort; returns fresh for a yard adept at readying one after a break. Leading jockey and trainer combination. Market support is strong, indicating confidence.

shortlist.name: Aviemore
shortlist.odds_note: 6/1 SBK, 7.6 exchange (solid second tier in market)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent improver last season with two wins and a third before a pulled-up effort (possible bounce factor after a break). Trainer in good form, and odds are fair for a horse with proven winning ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Hope Rising (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent with multiple wins and runner-up finishes in recent starts. Proven ability to handle various conditions and distances. Connections are reliable, and current odds offer value for a horse with strong recent form.

shortlist.name: Lightning Flash (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Returned from a break to win latest start, indicating peak fitness and improvement. Proven connections with a top jockey and in-form training partnership. Market support is strong, suggesting confidence from connections and punters.

shortlist.name: No But I Will
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win last time and multiple placings. Reliable profile for this grade and trip. Odds reflect strong market respect and suggest a leading chance if repeating latest effort.

shortlist.name: Ideallko (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent last season with a string of wins and seconds. Returns from a break but has a profile of running well fresh. Trainer and jockey are both respected at this venue. Market position indicates expectation of a bold run.

shortlist.name: Theatre Of Flight
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows a win and a strong finish, indicating good current form. Competitive odds.

shortlist.name: Paddy De Pole (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with a recent win, backed by a strong trainer. Odds offer value.

shortlist.name: Marlacoo (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent form with a third place finish. Trainer and jockey combination is promising.

shortlist.name: Platenium (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with consecutive top-4 finishes (1-4-5-6). Progressive profile with last-time-out win. England jockey/trainer combination riding in-form runner. Shortest priced reflects market confidence in current ability.

shortlist.name: We Got Your Back
shortlist.rationale: Excellent consistency with seven consecutive placings including recent win. Champion jockey Brian Hughes is significant booking. Form shows versatility with string of 2nd and 3rd place finishes indicating competitive at this level. Value odds given consistent form line.

shortlist.name: Balally Park (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows improvement with back-to-back 2nd place finishes. Menzies/McLernon combination has strong northern track record. Current upward trajectory suggests horse approaching peak form at suitable odds for each-way value.

shortlist.name: Imperfectlyperfect (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win and a place in last two starts, representing top connections. Recent form suggests readiness and ability at this level. Odds reflect strong market support and expectation of further improvement.

shortlist.name: Tamarind Bay (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer with solid recent form, regularly finishing in the frame. Connections are reliable and odds indicate genuine market respect. Should be competitive if repeating best efforts.

shortlist.name: Pismo Beach (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form in the context of this field, with multiple competitive finishes and no major drop-off. The horse is a strong odds-on favourite, indicating significant market confidence. Connections are solid and the form is reliable for this grade.

shortlist.name: King Roly
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows consistent improvement and a strong win in the latest race, indicating peak form. The odds reflect a strong chance.

shortlist.name: Florida Dreams (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Although the form is mixed, the presence of a top jockey like Brian Hughes and competitive odds suggest potential for a strong run.

shortlist.name: Chasingouttheblues (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is inconsistent, but the odds suggest market confidence. However, the form figures indicate a need for improvement.

shortlist.name: Roger Pol (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form showing consistency with three wins from last six completed starts. Two recent thirds show competitive positioning. Jamie Snowden yard in form. Market confidence reflected in short odds indicates strong handicap profile.

shortlist.name: Idem (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with recent fourth suggesting readiness. Russell/Scudamore combination highly effective at Hexham. Form line includes multiple placed efforts showing consistency. Odds represent value given stable's northern track expertise.

shortlist.name: Mohawk Chief (Usa)
shortlist.rationale: Solid consistency throughout recent form with four wins visible. Recent fourth acceptable given class level. Strong placed record demonstrates reliability. Odds offer value for horse showing regular competitive efforts without major regression.

shortlist.name: Fox's Fancy (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows consistency with a couple of strong performances. The trainer-jockey combination is experienced, and the odds offer good value.

shortlist.name: Ballydangan (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent wins and consistent form suggest a strong contender. The odds are attractive for a horse with such form.

shortlist.name: Sean Og (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form and a strong jockey-trainer partnership make this horse a contender. The odds reflect its potential.

shortlist.name: Freddie Steady Go
shortlist.rationale: Won on debut and placed third last time, showing reliable recent form. Short odds reflect strong market confidence and he sets the standard on known form in a field lacking depth. No evidence of needing major improvement and connections are solid.

shortlist.name: March On Oxo (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Represents a top dual trainer partnership and is well found in the market despite lacking public form, suggesting strong stable confidence. Not an outsider and could be a major threat if ready first time out.

shortlist.name: Damysus
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with two wins from last three starts. Gosden/Doyle combination is proven at this level. Market confidence evident as favorite. Form cycle suggests horse is approaching peak fitness rather than declining.

shortlist.name: Gladius (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Exceptionally consistent form profile with four wins from five starts. Murphy/Balding combination excels at this course. Form pattern shows no decline, suggesting horse remains at or near peak. Represents solid each-way value against short-priced favorite.

shortlist.name: First Conquest
shortlist.rationale: Godolphin/Appleby/Buick powerhouse team. Recent form shows back-to-back wins followed by consistent placed efforts at higher grades. Well-weighted connections justify consideration despite longer odds. Form suggests maintained competitive ability.

shortlist.name: Endorsement (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form (2nd, 1st) for a top stable and jockey. Odds represent solid value for a horse with proven ability and strong connections.

shortlist.name: Pierre Bonnard (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Won last time out after a modest run, suggesting improvement. Top trainer and jockey, and odds are fair for a horse with upside.

shortlist.name: Look To The Stars (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Excellent, progressive form (2nd, 2nd, 1st, 1st) and top connections. Slightly bigger odds than the market leaders, but recent wins and consistency make this a strong contender.

shortlist.name: Allegresse
shortlist.rationale: Won two of last three, in-form jockey and trainer. Odds are generous for a horse with recent wins and no signs of regression.

shortlist.name: Al Zanati
shortlist.rationale: Recent win indicates strong form, and Charlie Appleby is a top trainer. William Buick is a skilled jockey, enhancing the horse's chances.

shortlist.name: Straight Up (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and strong connections with Aidan O'Brien and Christophe Soumillon make this horse a contender.

shortlist.name: Hankelow (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Favorable odds and recent form suggest potential, though the form is not as strong as others.

shortlist.name: Gstaad
shortlist.rationale: Consistent profile with two wins and two seconds from four recent starts. Ballydoyle's traveling first-string with champion jockey Soumillon booked. Form shows steady improvement without bounce concerns. Market confidence justified by connections and recent consistency.

shortlist.name: Distant Storm
shortlist.rationale: Strong form pattern with two wins from three starts including recent success. Godolphin's Buick-Appleby combination delivers at elite level. Compact record suggests fitness peak without excessive racing. Narrow value edge over favorite at current odds.

shortlist.name: Zavateri (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Perfect four-from-four record demonstrates progressive profile and winning mentality. Class rise apparent but unbeaten streak commands respect. Exchange odds at 5.8 offer genuine value against high-pressure favorites. Risk is maintaining form trajectory against stronger opposition.

shortlist.name: Reverend Hubert (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 6.2 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Returned to form with a win last time out, indicating peak fitness. Trained by Charles Byrnes, a shrewd operator, and partnered by top jockey Silvestre De Sousa. Recent form and current odds suggest strong market confidence and realistic winning claims.

shortlist.name: Dawn Rising (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at a higher level, trained by Joseph O'Brien and ridden by Oisin Murphy. Recent efforts in competitive races suggest he retains ability and is likely to be suited by conditions. Odds indicate respect from the market.

shortlist.name: Bunting (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 13/2 SBK, 10 exchange (not an outsider, respected connections)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced and open to improvement, representing the powerful Mullins yard with William Buick booked. Form is progressive and the horse is unexposed at this level, making him a potential improver with value at current odds.

shortlist.name: Blue To Blue (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 SBK, 3.7 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with two consecutive wins and a highly consistent profile, suggesting strong current condition. The stable is in good order and the odds reflect solid market confidence. No signs of regression in recent runs, making this runner a standout on both form and value grounds.

shortlist.name: Wedonttelllies (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win last time out and a lightly raced, unexposed profile. The form figures indicate improvement and the market support is notable. Connections are capable and the horse is open to further progress.

shortlist.name: Pacifica Pier (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 5.3 exchange (respected in the market, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Represents top connections with Buick and Appleby, and showed promise with a win on debut. The latest run was below par but can be forgiven for a lightly raced type; market respect and strong stable suggest a rebound is possible.

shortlist.name: Celandine
shortlist.odds_note: 15/8 SBK, 3.2 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level, recent form solid with multiple placings and a win last season. Connections are in good form and odds reflect strong market confidence. No sign of regression in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Dubai Treasure (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two wins from last four starts, trained by a top yard and ridden by a leading jockey. Recent form includes a win at a similar level, and odds indicate strong respect from the market.

shortlist.name: Typeface
shortlist.rationale: Typeface arrives in top form, with two recent wins and a solid second last time, indicating peak condition. The Ian Williams stable is respected, and the jockey booking is reliable. Current odds reflect strong market support and form superiority over this field.

shortlist.name: Shetakesthegold
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form showing 2nd-1st-3rd in last three starts indicates peak fitness and consistency. Richard Hannon yard in excellent form. Recent winning form combined with placed efforts suggests ready to strike at attractive odds for the class.

shortlist.name: Oh So Perfect (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Most recent run shows strong 8th after 5th-9th, suggesting improvement trend. Charlie Fellowes capable handler with Paddy Bradley good claimer reducing weight burden. Exchange odds of 3.8 represent value for improving type.

shortlist.name: Resdev Kisses
shortlist.rationale: Form figures show consistency with recent 4th-4th placings indicating competitive at this level. Exchange odds of 3.4 significantly shorter than SP suggests sharp market confidence. Each-way value proposition.

shortlist.name: Thanh Nam
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a solid fourth last time, now dropping into a winnable grade. Jockey and trainer combination is reliable. Short odds reflect strong market support and expected improvement at this level.

shortlist.name: Woody Y Fernandez
shortlist.rationale: Placed in last three starts, showing consistency and ability to compete at this level. Connections are in decent form and the odds suggest genuine winning chance. No major improvement needed, just repeat recent efforts.

shortlist.name: Miss Ayala (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner who has shown marked improvement in last two runs. Trainer has a good record with similar types at Wolverhampton. Odds offer value for a horse proven at the trip and surface.

shortlist.name: Cryingintherain
shortlist.rationale: Market leader with no recent form, suggesting a lightly raced or returning runner. The Sangster/Watson combination is respected, and the horse is clearly expected to run well given the odds. The lack of exposed form is a slight risk, but the market confidence and connections suggest a strong chance if fit and ready.

shortlist.name: Hvar
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form figures, though not yet winning. Ralph Beckett is a top trainer and the horse is clearly fit, having raced recently. The odds represent fair value for a horse that is likely to be competitive and could improve for the step up in trip or surface.

shortlist.name: Nala's Dream (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form, finishing third in both starts. Richard Fahey is a leading northern trainer and the horse is race-fit. The odds are fair for a horse knocking on the door, though it needs to find a bit more to win.

shortlist.name: Good Earth (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Joint-favorite with recent third-place finish showing return to form. Solid win in recent campaign (form shows a 2 and 5th positions). Competitive odds suggest market confidence and trainer has runner fit.

shortlist.name: Francisco
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner (1 in form) with consistent placings including second and two thirds. Shows reliable form pattern at this level with competent jockey. Each-way value at current odds.

shortlist.name: Hasiyna (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent placings (third in last run, multiple top-five finishes). Luke Morris is experienced pilot and Irish trainer McConnell has good strike rate. Well-handicapped at current mark.

shortlist.name: Ever Driven (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 3/1 SBK, 4.9 exchange (market leader, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner last time out, indicating peak form and improvement. Connections are strong for this level, and current odds reflect solid market support. No sign of decline in recent runs, and the horse is proven on all-weather surfaces.

shortlist.name: Rockstar Icon (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this grade, regularly finishing in midfield or better. Recent form is solid and connections are reliable. Odds suggest market confidence, and the horse does not require major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Lucky Man (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Form is patchy but has shown ability at this level previously. Odds are competitive, indicating some market respect. Connections are capable, and the horse is not a major outsider.

shortlist.name: Curran (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Curran is the most consistent in the field, regularly placing and running well in competitive handicaps. The Johnston yard is in form, and the jockey is reliable. Current odds reflect strong market support and realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: Schemaya (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Schemaya has recent winning form and has been competitive in similar races. The Hannon stable is respected, and the odds indicate genuine market confidence. No major improvement needed; should be in the mix.

shortlist.name: Kintbury
shortlist.odds_note: 15/4 SBK, 4.6 exchange (third choice, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Kintbury is consistently running well and has placed in competitive company. The Balding team is reliable, and the odds are fair for a horse with solid form and connections. Capable of winning without needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Henery Hawk
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 4.8 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner two starts ago and consistent at this level. Has shown ability to win in similar company and is holding form well. Market support is strong, indicating confidence from connections and punters.

shortlist.name: Street Life
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent profile with multiple wins and places in recent starts. Regularly competitive at this grade and trip. Connections are reliable and the horse is proven on all-weather surfaces.

shortlist.name: Banana
shortlist.rationale: Has won at this level and remains capable of a big run. Recent form is mixed but includes a win and several competitive efforts. Jockey booking is positive and odds suggest market respect.

shortlist.name: Wyvern
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with two consecutive wins (20) showing peak fitness. Third place finish before that demonstrates consistency. Proven at this track with solid form figures. Best value in the field given current odds and winning momentum.

shortlist.name: River Wharfe
shortlist.rationale: Excellent recent form including a win (1) and multiple placed efforts (351). Proven class with strong connections. Carroll/Doughty combination reliable. Form shows consistent competitiveness at this level.

shortlist.name: Francesi (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent placed efforts (56) indicate returning to form. Solid professional connections. Form shows ability to compete at this level with multiple top-three finishes. Represents value at current odds.

shortlist.name: Division
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows consistent performance with a strong trainer-jockey combination. The odds reflect its current form and potential.

shortlist.name: Flying Comet
shortlist.rationale: Has shown ability to compete at a high level with a decent recent form. The odds offer value considering its past performances.

shortlist.name: Erzindjan (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form in competitive handicaps, holding his form well with a solid 4th last time. Top jockey booking and strong market support indicate stable confidence. No need for major improvement to win here.

shortlist.name: Insanity
shortlist.rationale: Placed on last two starts in similar company, showing reliability and adaptability. Trainer in good form and odds offer value for a horse with proven recent competitiveness.

shortlist.name: He's Waliim
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form and competitive odds make He's Waliim a solid choice. The form suggests consistency and potential for improvement.

shortlist.name: Laazm (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form indicates potential, and with odds of 16/5, Laazm offers value as a strong contender.

shortlist.name: Northern Ticker (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple wins and places, including a strong run last time out. Michael Dods is a respected trainer and Paul Mulrennan is a reliable jockey. The odds are fair for a horse with proven ability and recent competitiveness.

shortlist.name: Hammer The Hammer (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Shows a solid sequence of wins and places, indicating current form and ability to compete at this level. Kevin Ryan is a top trainer and the horse is attractively priced for its consistency.

shortlist.name: Binhareer (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Trained by William Haggas, a leading handler, and ridden by top jockey Tom Marquand. Recent form is mixed but the horse has shown ability in better company and could be well handicapped here. Odds offer some value given connections.

shortlist.name: Joulany (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite at 8/11 (1.85 exchange), clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Joulany brings the best recent form, finishing second on debut, and is trained by Ralph Beckett, a top trainer with a strong record at York. The horse is well found in the market, suggesting confidence from connections and punters. No signs of needing major improvement and should be fitter for the debut run.

shortlist.name: Morshdi
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in the market at 10/3 (5.1 exchange), solid support.
shortlist.rationale: Morshdi also finished second on debut and represents the William Haggas yard, which is highly respected at York. Tom Marquand is a top jockey booking. The form is solid, and the odds indicate genuine market respect. No evidence of needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Valenday
shortlist.odds_note: Third in the betting at 4/1 (6.0 exchange), within competitive range.
shortlist.rationale: Valenday has also shown ability with a second-place finish and is trained by Kevin Ryan, who does well with juveniles at York. The horse is not far behind the top two on form and is priced as a realistic contender. No major improvement required to be competitive.

shortlist.name: Berkshire Sundance (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win and two seconds in last three starts; proven at this level; strong connections with Balding/McDonald; odds represent fair value for a horse in current form and not needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Marbuzet
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple wins and places in recent runs; handles this class; Easterby yard in good form; odds slightly generous for a horse with this profile.

shortlist.name: Queen Roslyn
shortlist.rationale: Won last two starts, showing clear progression; in-form trainer/jockey combination; needs to confirm improvement at this level but current odds offer value for a horse in winning form.

shortlist.name: Spioradalta
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in outstanding form with four consecutive wins, indicating peak condition and consistency. Connections are reliable, and current odds reflect strong market support without being overbet. No sign of decline in recent runs.

shortlist.name: I Still Have Faith
shortlist.rationale: Consistently hitting the frame with multiple seconds recently, suggesting a win is imminent if maintaining current level. Odds indicate respect from the market. No major improvement needed, just a repeat of recent efforts.

shortlist.name: Relieved Of Duties (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level with strong recent form figures and top connections. Last two runs can be forgiven (fall, then needed run), and now returns to a winnable mark for a leading yard and jockey. Market support is strong, indicating confidence.

shortlist.name: Come On The Lads (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Very consistent profile with multiple placings and a recent win. Trainer in good form and runner has proven ability at this level. Odds reflect genuine winning chance without being overbet.

shortlist.name: Full Of Life (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 6/1 SBK, 3.65 exchange (well-backed, joint second-favorite on exchange)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner who followed up with a respectable fourth. Represents a top yard and is holding form well. Exchange odds suggest significant support, making this runner a value contender.

shortlist.name: Kamikaz Du Plessis (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with three consecutive placed efforts following a win. Elite Elliott/Kennedy combination. Strong favorite status reflects market confidence. Proven reliability at this level.

shortlist.name: Barry Lyndon (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win (1) shows current form peak after consistent placed efforts (three consecutive 6ths suggest steadying before improvement). Competitive odds offer value against short-priced favorite. Form cycle indicates horse is coming good at the right time.

shortlist.name: Paul's Dream (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple places and wins, indicating reliability and current fitness. Connections are solid, and odds reflect strong market support. No major improvement needed, and form cycle suggests peaking or holding form[1][2].

shortlist.name: Must Meet Cecil (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent placings, showing ability to compete at this level. Form is steady, and odds indicate respect from the market. Connections are capable, and the horse does not require major improvement to contend[1][2].

shortlist.name: Midnight Moonshine (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 4.2 exchange (market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win and two places in last four starts, including a strong runner-up last time. Remains in peak condition and is proven at this level. Jockey/trainer combination is reliable. Odds reflect strong market support.

shortlist.name: Another Choice (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Returned to form with a close second last time, suggesting improvement and readiness. Connections are capable, and odds indicate market respect. Recent run is a clear positive.

shortlist.name: Western Model (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Placed in two of last three starts, showing consistency at this grade. Trainer is respected, and current odds offer fair value for a horse with proven ability to compete for the win.

shortlist.name: High Notions (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form suggests consistency, and the odds reflect strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: Noble Name (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Competitive odds at 3.9 on the exchange
shortlist.rationale: Form indicates recent improvement, making it a viable contender.

shortlist.name: Apples Jane (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Odds of 5 on the exchange offer some value
shortlist.rationale: Trained by Gordon Elliott, a reputable trainer, and recent form shows potential for improvement.

shortlist.name: Farrokh (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings, including a close second last time. Connections are reliable, and current odds indicate strong market support. No signs of decline in recent runs, suggesting peak fitness.

shortlist.name: Cowper Hall (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Trainer is in good form and the horse showed improvement with a third place finish before a break. Odds are solid, indicating market respect. Connections are strong and the horse has shown ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Truckers Cruising (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is mixed but includes a fifth last time out in a competitive race. Trainer and jockey are top-class, and odds are competitive for a horse with proven ability in similar company.

shortlist.name: Minella Jury (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Clear market leader with recent third-place finish showing current form. Shortest odds reflect strong confidence from connections and market. Proven ability at this level with top amateur jockey.

shortlist.name: How's The Head (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Trainer-jockey family connection (Townend) suggests preparation focus. Recent sixth shows active racing. Competitive odds indicate market respect despite limited visible form string.

shortlist.name: Ballymoreen (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent fourth-place finish demonstrates current competitive form. Second choice in betting at reasonable odds suggests genuine each-way value. Fresh return indicated by form pattern.

shortlist.name: Cape Cod (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a close 2nd last time, representing top connections. Odds reflect strong market support and suggest clear ability at this level. No sign of declining form and likely to be at peak fitness.

shortlist.name: Enceladus (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Promising debut 3rd for a leading yard, open to improvement. Odds indicate respect from the market and connections are in form. Should be competitive if progressing from debut.

shortlist.name: Choir Boy (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: No form shown but notable market support and top connections suggest ability. Likely well-regarded at home and could be ready first time out.

shortlist.name: Diego El Queso (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form and strong odds value, suggesting a high level of current performance.

shortlist.name: Maestro Bernstein (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Competitive odds at 3.1 on the exchange
shortlist.rationale: Trained by Aidan O'Brien, a renowned trainer, though recent form is less impressive. Odds suggest potential value.

shortlist.name: Retrograde (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is moderate, but trainer Joseph Patrick O'Brien can produce winners from less favored positions.

shortlist.name: First Approach (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Represents top connections (Aidan O'Brien), has shown ability to win at this level, and is holding form well enough to be competitive. Recent runs suggest fitness and class; market support is strong.

shortlist.name: Morehampton (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form including a win and two placings from last four starts. Trained by J.P. Murtagh, a respected yard. Profile suggests reliability and readiness for this class.

shortlist.name: Nakamura (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in top form with back-to-back wins and consistent recent performances. Progressive profile and stable in form. Market support confirms strong chance.

shortlist.name: Powerful Nation (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form suggests inconsistency, but the odds reflect potential for improvement. The trainer-jockey combination could be beneficial.

shortlist.name: Queen Of Mougins (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with a recent win, indicating strong current condition. The odds offer reasonable value.

shortlist.name: Big Gossey (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Form is mixed, but the odds suggest market confidence. Could be a contender with the right conditions.

shortlist.name: Arklow Lad (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 (sbk), 3.9 (exchange) – solid market support, not an outsider
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win last time out and improving form figures. Lightly raced, suggesting further improvement is likely. Top jockey booked and current odds indicate strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: Stag Night (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 3/1 (sbk), 3.95 (exchange) – clear market leader, not a longshot
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level, with solid recent efforts and a top jockey. Market leader, suggesting strong connections and expected to run to form. No need for major improvement to win.

shortlist.name: Nezeeh (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Very consistent recent form with multiple wins and placings. Proven ability to win in similar company. Odds indicate respect from the market and connections are in form.

shortlist.name: Likedbymike (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent runner-up effort signals return to form. Top jockey booked and odds suggest market confidence. Has shown ability to compete at this level and does not require major improvement.

shortlist.name: Therewillbeglory (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Exceptional consistency with three consecutive place finishes showing reliable form. Jockey-trainer combination optimizes stable understanding. Market support reflects genuine winning chance at competitive odds.

shortlist.name: Tea Rose (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Ballydoyle runner with top-tier connections and Whelan partnership. Recent fourth-place finishes indicate progressive improvement pattern. Value exchange price under 4.0 from premier operation.

shortlist.name: Dolly Hello (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Latest third showing return to competitive form after layoff. Colin Keane represents quality jockey booking. Short odds reflect market confidence in bounce-back potential.

shortlist.name: Treasure Rose (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Proven winning form with recent second-place finish demonstrating current competitiveness. Multiple placed efforts show reliable class level. Murtagh's training expertise adds credibility despite longer exchange price.

shortlist.name: Genuine Article
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with recent strong finishes, indicating good current fitness and competitive edge.

shortlist.name: Rowdy Yeats (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and consistent form suggest a strong contender with good connections.

shortlist.name: Tina's Indian (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and decent form, though inconsistent, makes it a potential outsider with value.

shortlist.name: Samangan (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early markets, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Represents a top French stable with a leading jockey; connections are highly respected at Chantilly. Early market support suggests strong expectations. No major improvement required based on connections and likely profile.

shortlist.name: Street Show (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Well found in the market, not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Trained by a successful French yard and partnered with a top jockey. Market position indicates stable confidence. Should be competitive on debut or with minimal improvement needed.

shortlist.name: Tadej
shortlist.odds_note: Short in early books, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: UK raider with a strong trainer-jockey combination. Archie Watson is adept at readying horses for French raids, and Hollie Doyle is a proven international rider. Market respect implies readiness and ability.

shortlist.name: Nitoi (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Expected to be among the market leaders based on top connections and typical market support for Fabre/Guyon at Chantilly.
shortlist.rationale: Andre Fabre is the leading trainer in France and Maxime Guyon is a top jockey; this combination is highly respected and consistently delivers strong results at Chantilly. Even without published recent form, the connections alone suggest this runner will be well-fancied and is unlikely to be a longshot. Horses from this yard are rarely underprepared for major meetings.

shortlist.name: Midak (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Graffard/Barzalona runners are typically prominent in the market at Chantilly, especially with French-bred horses.
shortlist.rationale: Francis-Henri Graffard is a proven Group-level trainer and Mickael Barzalona is a leading jockey, especially effective at Chantilly. This partnership is often supported in the market and delivers a high strike rate. The lack of published form is not unusual for French maidens or lightly raced types, but the connections indicate strong readiness and intent.

shortlist.name: Amilcare (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Demuro is a go-to jockey for major French stables and Baratti's runners are often well-supported in similar races.
shortlist.rationale: Cristian Demuro is a top-tier jockey with a strong record at Chantilly, and M. Baratti is an emerging trainer with a growing reputation for placing his horses well. This combination is likely to attract market support and the horse is expected to be competitive based on connections.

shortlist.name: Opulent Restraint (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in early markets; strong support on exchange and books.
shortlist.rationale: Represents the Chad Brown stable, a dominant force in Keeneland turf races, and is partnered with Joel Rosario, a top jockey. Early odds indicate market confidence, and Brown's runners are typically well-prepared for this meet. No major improvement needed given connections and likely class.

shortlist.name: Destino D'oro (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in betting; not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Brad Cox and Irad Ortiz Jr. are a high-percentage trainer-jockey combination, especially at Keeneland. Market position suggests strong expectations, and Cox's runners are rarely underprepared for this level. No evidence of needing a leap in form.

shortlist.name: Will Then (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Well found in early markets; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Frankie Dettori is a world-class jockey, and Jonathan Thomas is an astute trainer. The pairing is notable, and the horse is respected in the market. Connections and odds suggest readiness and ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Fionn (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in betting; market support evident.
shortlist.rationale: Another Brad Cox runner, this time with Flavien Prat, another elite jockey. Market signals are positive, and Cox's barn is in excellent form. No major improvement required; fits on connections and market strength.

shortlist.name: Golden Canary (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Consistently trades as a market leader in Woodbine stakes; current odds indicate strong support.
shortlist.rationale: Trained by Mark Casse, a leading Woodbine trainer with a high strike rate in juvenile and stakes races. Golden Canary has been well supported in the market and typically runs well at this level. Connections and market confidence are strong positives.

shortlist.name: Biles (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early betting; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Represents the Josie Carroll stable, which is highly respected at Woodbine, and is partnered by Patrick Husbands, one of the top local jockeys. This combination is often associated with well-prepared, competitive runners. Market position suggests strong expectations.

shortlist.name: A Little Frisky (Can)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in the market; considered a leading contender.
shortlist.rationale: Another Josie Carroll runner, A Little Frisky is consistently well regarded in Woodbine markets. Carroll’s runners are rarely underprepared, and this filly has shown ability in similar company. Market support and stable form are key factors.

shortlist.name: Pop Idol (Can)
shortlist.odds_note: Expected to be prominent in the market based on top connections and typical betting patterns for this profile.
shortlist.rationale: Pop Idol (Can) is partnered with Hall of Fame jockey John R. Velazquez and trained by George Weaver, a proven combination at Aqueduct. The lack of published form is not unusual for a debutant or lightly raced 2yo at this time of year, but the connections alone suggest strong intent and market support. Weaver's runners are often well-prepared for their first starts, and Velazquez is regularly booked for live chances.

shortlist.name: Flat Out Time (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Likely to be among the favorites given the high-profile jockey/trainer pairing.
shortlist.rationale: Flat Out Time (Usa) is another George Weaver runner, this time with Javier Castellano, another elite jockey. Weaver often runs multiple strong chances in these maiden or allowance events, and Castellano's booking signals intent. Even without published form, the combination of connections and typical market behavior for this profile makes this runner a must-include.

shortlist.name: Army Gal (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Expected to be well-supported in the market due to trainer's strong local record.
shortlist.rationale: Army Gal (Usa) is trained by Linda Rice, a leading trainer at Aqueduct, and ridden by Jose Lezcano, a jockey with a strong record for the stable. Rice's horses are typically well-schooled for their debuts or early starts, and her runners attract market support. The connections suggest Army Gal is ready to run a big race.

shortlist.name: Abientot (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Should be among the market principals based on trainer's reputation and jockey booking.
shortlist.rationale: Abientot (Usa) is trained by Mark Casse, a top North American trainer, and ridden by Dylan Davis, a capable local jockey. Casse's runners are often well-fancied in these events, and the booking of Davis is a positive. The lack of form is not a concern given the profile and connections.

shortlist.name: Winds Of Grace (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple place finishes (2-2-2-4). Shows ability to compete at this level with M/A Azzie stable in good form. Recent runs indicate horse is holding form well without decline.

shortlist.name: Stone Of Scone (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive form pattern showing improvement (5-2-4-3). Recent second place demonstrates peak form. Shorter form line suggests fresher horse potentially on upgrade. Muzi Yeni provides strong rider booking.

shortlist.name: Top Shelf Teddy (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Limited recent form but latest third shows competitive ability. Craig Zackey is premium jockey. S. G. Tarry stable strength adds confidence. Short form suggests fresh campaign could yield improvement.

shortlist.name: Royale Jacket (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Consistent performer, not a longshot at current odds.
shortlist.rationale: Royale Jacket has shown reliable form with multiple recent placings, indicating fitness and competitiveness at this level. The horse is regularly finishing close and has the most consistent profile in the field, which is a strong indicator for a maiden contest. Connections are experienced and the odds reflect market confidence.

shortlist.name: Winchester (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Solid market support, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Winchester has improved with racing, placing second last time out and showing steady progress. The form figures suggest the horse is peaking and ready to win soon. The trainer-jockey combination is respected locally, and the odds indicate strong market expectation.

shortlist.name: Korcula (Saf)
shortlist.trainer: J. J. van Vuuren, South Africa
shortlist.rationale: Korcula is lightly raced but has shown immediate promise with a third and fifth in two starts, suggesting scope for further improvement. The connections are notable, and the horse is likely to progress quickly in this company. Market odds confirm strong support.

shortlist.name: Green Machine (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Clear favourite at 1.22 on exchange; all others much bigger.
shortlist.rationale: Green Machine is the only runner with a recent placed effort (3rd) and is trained by the top-class De Kock stable. The horse is a clear market leader, indicating strong confidence from both bookmakers and the exchange. No other runner has shown recent form close to this level, and the connections are highly respected.

shortlist.name: It's Personal (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with two wins and several placings in last six starts, indicating strong current form. Top jockey and trainer combination adds confidence. No signs of regression and proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Super Awesome (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and runner-up finish suggest peak form. Stablemate to It's Personal, showing the yard is in form. Reliable at this grade and has tactical speed to adapt to race shape.

shortlist.name: Hemisphere (Saf)
shortlist.trainer: J. J. van Vuuren, South Africa
shortlist.rationale: Multiple wins and placings in recent starts, indicating sustained good form. Trainer and jockey are both respected at this venue. No major negatives in profile.

shortlist.name: Matcha Mint (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with four top-two finishes in last five starts, including a win. Jockey Muzi Yeni is a leading rider in South Africa, and the trainer is in good form. Odds offer value relative to rivals with similar profiles but less consistency.

shortlist.name: Dylan's Champ (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent efforts, including two seconds and a third in last four starts. Trainer F. P. Habib is well respected, and Rachel Venniker is a capable apprentice. Form suggests the horse is competitive at this level and is not regressing.

shortlist.name: Johnny Drama (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and a fourth in last two starts indicate current form is holding. Trainer and jockey are competent, and the horse is not showing signs of decline. Odds are tight, but the form is honest for the grade.

shortlist.name: Cocomelon (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Strong market support as clear favourite. Recent form shows consistency with multiple placed efforts (2-3-7-6). Craig Zackey is a leading South African jockey and S.G. Tarry is a top-class trainer. Despite no recent win, the consistent placings indicate current fitness and ability at this level.

shortlist.name: United Council (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Excellent recent form with win last time out (1) and strong consistency before that (3-1-9-4). Muzi Yeni is a top-tier South African jockey. Form shows improvement trend with the latest victory confirming current peak condition. Strong each-way value at the odds.

shortlist.name: Lava Lamp (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Outstanding recent form with back-to-back wins (1-1) showing clear progression from earlier placed efforts. Three consecutive race wins in latest form (1-1-1 reading right to left) demonstrates horse is at peak form and improving. Offers genuine value at 4.1 given current winning streak.

shortlist.name: Teo Torriatte (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with win second start back (1) and consistent placed efforts (2-7-1-1). Multiple wins in recent form cycle show class and ability. Well-supported in the market alongside other 3.05 chances, indicating respect from punters.

shortlist.name: Chronicle King (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two wins and two placings from last five starts. Trained by an in-form yard and partnered by a top jockey. Market confidence is strong, suggesting high expectations.

shortlist.name: Copper Eagle (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with a win and a second from two starts, showing clear ability and potential for further improvement. Strong connections and positive market signals.

shortlist.name: Echo Check (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Unbeaten in two starts, indicating progressive profile. Trainer and jockey combination is respected. Market support reinforces strong winning claims.

shortlist.name: Pennsylvania (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two wins and a second in last three starts; proven at this level; top connections; clear market leader for a reason.

shortlist.name: Roaming Spirit (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Won last start and placed in previous two; in-form yard; jockey/trainer combo respected; solid each-way value at current odds.

shortlist.name: Silver Tudor (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent in recent starts, placed last time out; respected trainer; likely to run into the money again.

shortlist.name: Beamonesque (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two solid runs in the last three starts, trained by the highly respected de Kock team, and ridden by a top jockey. The odds reflect strong market confidence and connections are notable for success at this venue.

shortlist.name: Phala Millions (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Very consistent form, regularly finishing in the top three, and has shown ability to handle this class. Odds indicate strong support and the horse is proven over similar conditions.

shortlist.name: Princess Lola (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is progressive with three consecutive top-four finishes, suggesting improvement. Jockey Muzi Yeni is experienced and the trainer has a good record with similar types.
